# nv_typewriter

The [novelibre](https://github.com/peter88213/novelibre/) Python program helps authors organize novels.  

*nv_typewriter* is a "distraction free editor" plugin for novelibre

![Screenshot](docs/Screenshots/screen01.jpg)


## Requirements

- [novelibre](https://github.com/peter88213/novelibre/) version 5.38+

## Download and install

### Default: Executable Python zip archive

Download the latest release [nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.pyz](https://github.com/peter88213/nv_typewriter/raw/main/dist/nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.pyz)

- Launch *nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.pyz* by double-clicking (Windows desktop),
- or execute `python nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.pyz` (Windows), resp. `python3 nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.pyz` (Linux) on the command line.

#### Important

Many web browsers recognize the download as an executable file and offer to open it immediately. 
This starts the installation under Windows.

However, depending on your security settings, your browser may 
initially  refuse  to download the executable file. 
In this case, your confirmation or an additional action is required. 
If this is not possible, you have the option of downloading 
the zip file. 


### Alternative: Zip file

The package is also available in zip format: [nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.zip](https://github.com/peter88213/nv_typewriter/raw/main/dist/nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.zip)

- Extract the *nv_typewriter_v0.99.0* folder from the downloaded zipfile "nv_typewriter_v0.99.0.zip".
- Move into this new folder and launch *setup.py* by double-clicking (Windows/Linux desktop), 
- or execute `python setup.py` (Windows), resp. `python3 setup.py` (Linux) on the command line.
